current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
Congratulating the Baltimore Ravens for
		  winning Super Bowl XLVII.

cosponsor.#tail:
) submitted the following
			 resolution; which was considered and agreed to

text.#text: That the

congratulates the
			 Baltimore Ravens for winning Super Bowl XLVII;

recognizes the
			 achievements of all the players, coaches, and staff who contributed to the 2012
			 championship season; and

requests that the
			 Secretary of the Senate prepare an enrolled version of this resolution for
			 presentation to—

the owner of the
			 Baltimore Ravens, Steve Biscotti;

the head coach of
			 the Baltimore Ravens, John Harbaugh; and

the now-retired
			 field leader of the Baltimore Ravens, Ray Lewis.

Whereas Super Bowl XLVII marks the second Super Bowl win
			 for the Baltimore Ravens, the third Super Bowl win for a Baltimore football
			 team, and the first time in history that siblings have coached opposing teams
			 in the Super Bowl;

Whereas the Baltimore Ravens exhibited a stellar offensive
			 performance, with 93 rushing yards and 274 passing yards;

Whereas the Baltimore Ravens' defense forced turnovers
			 that were critical to achieving a victory;

Whereas linebacker Terrell Suggs tore his achilles tendon
			 in the offseason but made a full recovery to play in the Super Bowl;

Whereas receiver Anquan Boldin caught 6 passes for 104
			 yards and a touchdown;

Whereas members of the Baltimore Ravens organization have
			 helped their community through charitable work and advocacy; and

Whereas the Baltimore Ravens have brought great pride and
			 honor to the City of Baltimore, its loyal fans, and the entire State of
			 Maryland: Now, therefore, be it

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 SRES 35 ATS: Congratulating the Baltimore Ravens for winning Super Bowl XLVII.
